channel.title: Posts on QSCI 381 Labs
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on QSCI 381 Labs

item.title: Lab 07
item.description: Lab 07 Skills Slides Lab 07 Report Template Homework (optional) For each question: show all mathematical work and include all code, plus output from R or graphs. Make sure to answer all sub-questions. All plots should be appropriately labeled and titled. Problem 1 For this problem, we’ll be taking a look at the evals dataset from the moderndive package. First, run the command install.packages("moderndive"). library(moderndive) data(evals) Provide a scatterplot with score on the y-axis and age on the x-axis.

item.title: Lab 06
item.description: Lab 06 Skills Slides Lab 06 Report Template Homework For each question: show all mathematical work and include all code, plus output from R or graphs. Make sure to answer all sub-questions. All plots should be appropriately labeled and titled. Problem 1 For this problem, we’ll be taking a data set on sale prices of homes sold between May 2014 and May 2015 in the Wallingford neighborhood of Seattle.

item.title: Lab 05
item.description: Lab 05 Skills Slides Lab 05 Report Template Homework For each question: show all mathematical work and include all code, plus output from R or graphs. Make sure to answer all sub-questions. Problem 1 For this problem, we’ll be taking a look at the ButterfliesBc dataset from the Stat2Data package, which includes measurements from a small sample of butterflies in Greenland. First, run the command install.packages("Stat2Data"). library(Stat2Data) data("ButterfliesBc") Create two box plots on the same axes, one for male wing lengths and one for female wing lengths.

item.title: Lab 04
item.description: Lab 04 Skills Slides Lab 04 Report Template Homework For each question: show all mathematical work and include all code, plus output from R or graphs. Make sure to answer all sub-questions. Problem 1 (OpenIntro Exercise 4.8) The Capital Asset Pricing Model (CAPM) is a financial model that assumes returns on a portfolio are normally distributed. Suppose a portfolio has an average annual return of 14.7% (i.e. an average gain of 14.

item.title: Lab 03
item.description: Lab 03 Skills Slides Lab 03 Report Template Lab 03 Data Homework For each question: show all mathematical work and include all code, plus output from R or graphs. Make sure to answer all sub-questions. Problem 1 First, load and clean the data using the following code, being sure to insert the appropriate file path instead of PATH_TO_DATA. # load package of helpful datasets and functions library(tidyverse) library(lubridate) # load data daily_rain <- readr::read_csv("PATH_TO_DATA/seattleWeather_1948-2017.

item.title: Lab 02
item.description: Lab 02 Skills Slides Lab 02 Report Template Homework For each question: show all mathematical work and include all code, plus output from R or graphs. Make sure to answer all sub-questions. First, load and clean the data using the following code: # load package of helpful datasets and functions library(tidyverse) # load data tuition_cost <- readr::read_csv(paste0( 'https://raw.githubusercontent.com/', 'rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/', 'data/2020/2020-03-10/tuition_cost.csv')) # remove other tuition_cost <- tuition_cost %>% filter(type !

item.title: Lab 01
item.description: R Basics Slides Lab 01 Skills Slides Lab 01 Report Template Practice and extension The ChickWeight dataset provides data on a sample of fifty chicks, each fed one of four different diets. For each chick, the data frame includes weight measurements at birth and every other day thereafter. First, load the data. You can use the commands: # load ChickWeight dataset data("ChickWeight") Print out the weights of the chicks on day 0.

item.title: Lab 00
item.description: Before your first lab section, you should work through the slides below to install R and check that all the software works on your computer. Slides Lab 00 Report Template If, when you download the template, you don’t see the header, you can copy and paste the header below: --- title: "Lab 00 Report" author: "YOUR NAME HERE" date: "DATE HERE" output: html_document ---
